content.question: Which of the following series is conditionally convergent?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum from k equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power, times the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator k cubed, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum from k equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power, times the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator k plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum from k equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power, times the fraction with numerator 5 k, and denominator k plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum from k equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power, times the fraction with numerator 5 times k squared, and denominator k plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum from k equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power, times the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator k plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.9: (BC ONLY) Determining Absolute or Conditional Convergence

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
